result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackenzie W Donath

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. McMahon requesting to reschedule the 11/4/22 Hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Dreyfus, for Branch 7, 11/2/22 - Request granted.**

3:18 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Mackenzie W Donath.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. McMahon provides an update; she notes the defendant has a new felony matter set for prelim on October 26th.  Atty. McMahon requests a further proceedings date after October 26th so all matters can then be set together.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

10:20 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Mackenzie W Donath in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. McMahon provides an update, she needs additional time to work with the State to resolve the matter.  Atty. McMahon requests a further proceedings date in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:30 AM Defendant Mackenzie W Donath in court with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
